intro: Chondrocarpus dilankurii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and long, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear both male and female flowers. It is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in moist, well-drained environments. Chondrocarpus dilankurii has historical significance for Māori culture and was traditionally used for weaving and other crafts.
